Thurs., Sept. 21: Learn what your rights are when stopped by police and ICE.
  


Know Your Rights: Immigrants' Rights Training

Thursday, September 21, 4 p.m.
Hanover Friends Meeting House
43 Lebanon Street
Hanover, NH 03755

RSVP on Facebook
Share this:           

Immigrants' Rights Training

Welcoming immigrants and rescuing refuges is part of who we are as a country. Unfortunately, the Trump Administration seems determined to impose policies that rip families apart, damage local communities and attack our nation's core values.

With a live free or die way of life, us Granite Staters must stand together in support of our immigrant neighbors as they strive to raise their families to live free and contribute to the prosperity of New Hampshire. Come learn how to give Know Your Rights presentations to immigrants to protect immigrant communities in the Granite State.

Know Your Rights When Stopped by Police & ICE: Immigrants' Rights Training
Thursday, September 21, 4 – 5:30 p.m.
Hanover Friends Meeting House
43 Lebanon Street
Hanover, NH 03755
RSVP on Facebook

This training, co-presented by ACLU of NH’s Executive Director Devon Chaffee and Legal Director Gilles Bissonnette, will provide you with the tools you need to help educate service providers, institutions, and community members on the rights of immigrants and how invoking those rights can help keep immigrants and their families safe. The training will address:

  • What steps individuals without a documented immigration status can take to protect themselves, their families and their property.
  • What rights individuals have when ICE agents come to their home and when stopped by police.
  • Recent developments in federal and local immigration enforcement.

We welcome all individuals committed to taking action to support immigrant communities in our state. Attorneys and others with legal or language expertise are particularly encouraged to participate.

Sincerely,

Devon Chaffee
Executive Director
ACLU of New Hampshire

RSVP on Facebook
